See you on Thursday on #InvestmentMatters. Have a great week!
That will be all for today folks. We shall use another time to delve deep into each type of investment.  #InvestmentMatters
You can invest in real estate and reduce risk by choosing a mutual fund that invests in the real estate market. #InvestmentMatters
There r gold & real estate investments in Ghana but risks r high just as returns are high.Options & futures r not common. #InvestmentMatters
Examples of these other investments are options, futures, Gold and Real Estate. #InvestmentMatters
There are however, other types of investments that have high return and equally high risk. #InvestmentMatters
These are the 3 common types of investments in Ghana: fixed income securities,  stocks and mutual funds. #InvestmentMatters
Every mutual fund has a fund manager that manages the day to day running. The fund manager is usually an investment bank #InvestmentMatters
Mutual funds helps to reduce risk that you would have exposed to if u directly invested in a security.  #InvestmentMatters
So instead of directly investing in say, stocks or fixed income, you can choose a mutal fund that does so. #InvestmentMatters
A mutual fund is normally set up to invest in stocks, fixed income or a combination of both. Some are even set up to invest in real estate.
A mutual fund is an investment vehicle that enables investors pool their resources together for investment.  #InvestmentMatters
Mutual funds are another type of investment popular in Ghana recently. #InvestmentMatters
This means that whenever that company declares profit/dividends, you will have ur share. #InvestmentMatters
When u own a stock of a company, u become an owner of that company which makes u entitled to share in profits(dividends). #InvestmentMatters
For example, u buy a stock for Ghc 1. The price rises in 3 months and you are able to sell at Ghc 2. That's a 100% profit #InvestmentMatters
Investment in stocks is long term & u benefit by making profit on the sale or receivn what is known as dividend. #InvestmentMatters
A stock is a unit or part of a company,  so when you own a stock, u own part of the company whose stock u bought.  #InvestmentMatters
Stocks are traded (bought and sold) on the Ghana Stock Exchange. #InvestmentMatters
Another type of investment common in Ghana are stocks. #InvestmentMatters
We shall go into more details on another day when we are looking strictly at fixed income securities. #InvestmentMatters
Remember,  any investment with a fixed rate and fixed time period qualifies as a fixed income security.  #InvestmentMatters
Other examples of fixed income securities are bonds and what we know as fixed deposits with financial institutions. #InvestmentMatters
Fixed Income securities are investments that have a fixed rate and a fixed time period. An example is a Treasury Bill. #InvestmentMatters
There are different types of investments available in Ghana. First we will look at fixed income securities. #InvestmentMatters
This means, today, we are going to learn what you can do to make ur money work for you. #InvestmentMatters
Hope you remember that investing you momey is simply making ur money work for you #InvestmentMatters
On #InvestmentMatters today, we shall look at the different types of investments.  Don't hesitate to ask questions
Good evening ladies and gentlemen!  Welcome to today's edition of #InvestmentMatters
#InvestmentMatters coming up in about 3o minutes. Get your investment hat ready 😊
@mykwesi 😊
See you next week Tuesday as we delve deeper into this investment business on  #InvestmentMatters. Thank you for your time. Good evening
I hope my explanations have been clear enough and that you have learnt something new today.  That will be all for today! #InvestmentMatters
Investments banks deal with managing wealth of individuals & institutions by adding value to the assets thru investments  #InvestmentMatters
An investment bank is a bank that provides financial services that are not provided by commercial banks.  #InvestmentMatters
our last term for today is an Investment Bank.  #InvestmentMatters
Example of capital market investments are stocks and bonds which are typical more than a year.  #InvestmentMatters
The capital market caters for all long term investments in the industry. Capital market investments are more than a year  #InvestmentMatters
You cannot mention the money market without talking about the capital market, another popular term  #InvestmentMatters
The money market caters for all short term investments in the financial industry. Hence, all money market instruments are less than a year
Another favorite term in investments is the Money Market  #InvestmentMatters
An investments professional who manages ur investments will always refer to your investments as ur investment porfolio  #InvestmentMatters
For instance, if you have investments in stocks, fixed deposits & mutual funds, all these would make up your portfolio  #InvestmentMatters
Portfolio is a very common term in investments. A portfolio refers to a collection of securities held by an investor  #InvestmentMatters
On the other hand, long term investments are those that last more than a year. Example, investments on the stock market  #InvestmentMatters
Short term investments are those investments that mature within a year. Most short term investments are a year or less #InvestmentMatters
Another term you would usually hear is short term and long term. #InvestmentMatters
Example, an investment of GHC 100 for 1 year at 25%; the principal of this investment is the GHC 100,  #InvestmentMatters
Our first terminology for today is Principal. The principal of an investment is the initial amount invested.  #InvestmentMatters
Trust you have been learning a lot on  #InvestmentMatters. Today, we continue our discussion on some common terminologies in investments
Good evening investors! Its that time of the day again. Welcome to #InvestmentMatters where investments are made simple!
Today on #InvestmentMatters, we shall be continuing where we left off on Tuesday by concluding the lesson on common terminologies
Good evening folks #InvestmentMatters comes up in about 30 minutes. Looking forward to today's lesson

Folks, its been great hanging with you today. We will continue with some more terms on Thursday so do tune in. #InvestmentMatters
Some jurisdictions may differ in the explanation of a security but being a tradable financial asset is generally accepted #InvestmentMatters
A security normally represents any form financial instrument that can be traded. Examples, shares, mutual funds, etc #InvestmentMatters
The last terminology for today we will look at is a Security. In investments, a security is simply a financial asset #InvestmentMatters
Example, You make an investment today, 28th June 2015 for 1 year; the due or maturity date will be on 28th of June, 2016 #InvestmentMatters
As the name implies, due date or maturity date is when ur investment matures and is due for collection by u, the investor #InvestmentMatters
Similar to Investment Date is another term known as Due Date. Due date is also known as maturity date #InvestmentMatters
For example, if you make an investment today, then your investment date will be today #InvestmentMatters
Investment Date, another common term in investments, means the date at which your investment starts to run #InvestmentMatters
Diversification helps you to reduce risk, such that if one investment fails, the other still exists #InvestmentMatters
For example, if u have GHC 1000, instead of putting all in a fixed deposit, u diversify by investing half in stocks and rest in a fixed term
When you diversify your investments, it means your investments are made in different classes of investment products #InvestmentMatters
Another terminology is diversification. It is the practice of investing in a variety of investments to reduce risk #InvestmentMatters
For example, an investment of GHC 100 for 1 year at 25% means the interest rate is 25% per annum #InvestmentMatters
Interest rate is simply the rate at which interest is paid to the investor and are quoted annually #InvestmentMatters
The first and most common term is, Interest Rate. An interest rate is a percentage of the principal paid to the investor #InvestmentMatters
In your bid to invest, investment professionals tend to use terms and it helps to know exactly what they are referring to #InvestmentMatters
Remember that, to catch up, you can always visit previous tweets!Today, we will look at some terminologies in investments #InvestmentMatters
If u've been following our talks, I'm sure u would remember the last topic we discusd on #InvestmentMatters.We looked at time value of money

Dear All, I trust you now understand, in simple terms, what the time value of money means! Thanks for ur audience #InvestmentMatters
Kwabena learns a valuable lesson that #GHC 100 is worth more now that later. His dad explains it as; time value of money #InvestmentMatters
By the time Kwabena receives his GHC 100 from his dad, Kofi's GHC 100 is almost GHC 105. Their dad congratulates Kofi #InvestmentMatters
Kofi collects his GHC 100 and secretly makes an investment that gives him 10% per annum for 6 months #Investment Matters
Kofi opts for now; Kwabena opts 4 6 mnths time. Kwabena laughs at Kofi becos he is sure his wud be finished by the time he is collecting his
Their father decides to test them by asking, if the wud prefer the GHC 100 now or in 6 months #InvestmentMatters
Another example, Kofi and Kwabena are brothers and their father has promised them GHC 100 each for obeying house rules #InvestmentMatters
So, if you are faced with receiving GHC 100 now or next year, choose to receive it now because it will be worth more #InvestmentMatters
For example, you can invest that GHC 100 for a year at a rate of 5% per annum. By year end it will be worth GHC 105 #InvestmentMatters
According to investment and finance professionals,  if you receive GHC 100 today, you can invest it and make some profit #InvestmentMatters
Now, why is that so? #InvestmentMatters
In simple terms, it means receiving GHC 100 today is worth more than receiving the same GHC 100 next year #InvestmentMatters
The time value of money is the idea that receiving an amount today is worth more than receiving the same amount in future #InvestmentMatters
Truth is that, it can be very technical and comprises of calculations and formulas but today, let's break it down #InvestmentMatters
I am very sure you've heard pple use this term, Time Value of Money in talking about investments #InvestmentMatters
Today's topic on #InvestmentMatters is The Time Value of Money
If you want a recap of why we need to invest, do check last Thursday's lesson #InvestmentMatters
On Thursday, we talked about why we need to invest & an important point noted was that not investing in itself was risky #InvestmentMatters

4.Investing helps U to create wealth! Investing and investing right makes you wealthy! Just ask Warren Buffet 😊 #InvestmentMatters
Financial independence doesnt make U feel pressure to borrow. On the other hand,it puts U in the best position to borrow #InvestmentMatters
3.Investing makes U financially independent! U will realise that U can easily embark on personal projects without hassle #InvestmentMatters
2. We invest becos it enables us meet our personal and finacial goals. Example investing towards the purchase of a house #InvestmentMatters
This is becos the prices of goods & services are mostly on the rise. So, GHC100 today wud buy less than it did 1 yr ago #InvestmentMatters
1. We invest to beat inflation! This is because GHC 100 today will not have the same value come next year #InvestmentMatters
Now, let us look at why we need to invest #InvestmentMatters
We can always forgo some treats to set aside some money to invest. Instead of buying 2 pairs of new shoes, buy 1 & invest #InvestmentMattwrs
But the truth is, we don't need to have enough before we can invest! We spend money on clothes, shoes, icecream, etc #InvestmentMatters
Now, why should we invest? Most of us deceive ourselves that we just don't have enough to invest #InvestmentMatters
We also looked at how investing differs from saving. Hope you remember.  Do check previous tweets if u missed it #InvestmentMatters

Ladies and gentlemen, that’s all for today. It would be prudent for you to read and research more on investments #InvestmentMatters
saving is a plan to set aside part of your income over a short period of time to fulfil a short term goal. #InvestmentMatters
So where as investing involves making your money make more money for you, #InvestmentMatters
saving money normally caters for short term needs such as school fees for the next semester, etc. #InvestmentMatters
While investing is normally for long term goals such as building a house in the next 10 years #InvestmentMatters
...the opportunity to set some money aside for future uses, they have one main difference. #InvestmentMatters
Investing and saving are mostly used together in investments; though both tend to do the same thing of giving you... #InvestmentMatters
Investn basically entails putting money in a venture or financial instrument that will appreciate or yield profit .#InvestmentMatters
In simple terms,investing is makn your money grow or as investment professionals say;makn your money work for you.#InvestmentsMatters
Today, we shall talk about what investing is all about & also make some distinctions betwn the words;investing and saving #InvestmentMatters
